q: large sedans. ''You're going to see a new architecture on the line, a completely different architecture, completely rethought,'' Sergio Marchionne told Automotive News at the event. We've learned a lot in making this minivan over the last 20 plus years. We need to upgrade this and make it a much more versatile platform, one that will allow us to make more than just minivans. That idea is simply part of Sergio Marchionne 's plan to reduce the complexity of Chrysler( and, subsequently, Fiat's) product portfolio. The CEO hinted he's planning a very Volkswagen-esque future,

response to the current culture of government bailouts for corporations. When confronted with the news that the Big Three automakers will go under without government assistance, few can respond better than Indiana congressman Mike Pence : Economic freedom means the freedom to succeed and the freedom to fail. Is it possible to critique the idea of the corporation while still advocating capitalism? While rarely happening, yes, in fact it is. And Douglas Rushkoff shows us how in his fascinating new book.

Bernie Sanders , I-Vermont. Should we address the problem to make sure that it is there for our kids and our grandchildren? That Social Security is strong and secure for the next 75 years? Absolutely. Absolutely. But for people to come forward and say Social Security is collapsing, we've got to cut benefits tomorrow is totally untrue and we will not let it happen. Sen. Bernie Sanders has started a caucus of Senate members who oppose efforts to cut benefits, raise the retirement age or privatize Social Security. And if fixes must be made, Sen.
